data.title: Extend jail terms for domestic killers, says Brooke Kinsella
data.meta_description: The actress has urged the government to close a loophole wherein murderers who kill with a weapon already at the scene are given lighter sentences
data.text:
Brooke Kinsella, the former EastEnders actress who successfully campaigned for tougher prison sentences for knife killers after her brother was stabbed to death, has urged the government to close a loophole that is said to be ­denying justice to the ­families of hundreds of women who are murdered at home each year.

The government is considering ­whether to erase a ten-year disparity in murder sentencing that experts have called one of the greatest “remaining open sores” of the justice system.

At present, a killer who murders their victim with a knife “taken to the scene with intent” has a sentencing starting point of 25 years.

The tougher sentences were introduced in 2010 as part of a crackdown on urban knife crime after a campaign by
